alert.note: Alert for Cumberland; Harnett; Hoke; Lee; Moore; Richmond; Sampson; Scotland (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 09 at 5:35PM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southern Moore, northeastern Scotland, west central Sampson, Harnett, northeastern Richmond, Cumberland, south central Lee and Hoke Counties through 630 PM EDT... At 534 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Fayetteville, moving northwest at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Fayetteville, Southern Pines, Raeford, Lillington, Fort Liberty, Pinehurst, Aberdeen, Hoffman, Godwin and Pope AFB. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Cumberland; Harnett; Hoke; Lee; Moore; Richmond; Sampson; Scotland
